title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and Central provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Failed shooting in Dehiwala: Gunman killed in shootout with STF
byline: The gunman suspected to be involved in the failed shooting attempt near the railway station at Dehiwala yesterday has been shot dead by Police Special Task Force (STF) personnel following an exchange of gunfire at Pahalagama, Kahatuduwa.

title: Canadian national arrested with cocaine and Hashish at BIA
byline: A 52-year-old Canadian national has been arrested by Sri Lanka Customs officials at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake while attempting to smuggle 05 kg of cocaine and 12 kg of Hashish into the country.

title: President Anura Kumara to visit Maldives on Monday
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will undertake an official visit to the Maldives on Monday (July 28), at the invitation of Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu, Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath announced.

title: IMF to assess impact of external risks on Sri Lanka’s economy during fifth review
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has acknowledged Sri Lanka’s continued economic progress as the country prepares for its fifth review under the IMF-supported Extended Fund Facility (EFF) arrangement.

title: Turkish Minister reaffirms commitment to educational cooperation in meeting with PM
byline: The Minister of National Education of the Republic of Türkiye, Yusuf Tekin, paid a courtesy call on the Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, yesterday (24 July) at Parliament.

title: 4 children dead, 40 trapped in debris as India’s Rajasthan school building collapses
byline: At least four children were killed and several are feared trapped after a government school building collapsed in Rajasthan’s Jhalawar district on Friday.

title: France will recognise Palestinian state, Macron says
byline: France will officially recognise a Palestinian state in September, President Emmanuel Macron has said, which will make it the first G7 nation to do so.

title: IMF urges strong revenue measures in 2026 Budget to support Sri Lanka’s macroeconomic stability
byline: An International Monetary Fund (IMF) mission team, led by Evan Papageorgiou, IMF Mission Chief for Sri Lanka, concluded its visit to Colombo from July 21 to 25, 2025.

title: Sri Lanka and France sign debt restructuring implementation letters
byline: The Implementation Letter on Debt Restructuring between the Government of the French Republic and the Government of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, related to the External Debt Restructuring Process, was signed on 24 July 2025.

title: 4 children dead, 40 trapped in debris as school building collapses in India
byline: At least four children were killed and several are feared trapped after a government school building collapsed in Rajasthan’s Jhalawar district on Friday.

title: Former Minister P. Dayaratne passes away at 89
byline: Former Minister P. Dayaratne, a veteran politician and long-serving Member of Parliament from the Ampara District, has passed away at the age of 89, according to family sources.

title: PM vows legal action even against current govt officials over Easter attacks
byline: Prime Minister of Sri Lanka, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, stated that legal action will be taken even against any officials currently serving under the incumbent government if they are found guilty in connection with the Easter Sunday bomb attacks.

title: Hambantota Bird Park owner and 2 others further remanded
byline: The owner of a Bird Park in Nagarawewa, Hambantota, along with two other suspects, have been further remanded until July 30 for allegedly concealing illegally imported motorcycles in a warehouse.

title: Thailand, Cambodia exchange heavy artillery as fighting expands for second day
byline: Thailand and Cambodia exchanged heavy artillery fire for a second day on Friday as their worst fighting in over a decade intensified and spread to new areas, despite international calls for a ceasefire.

title: Elon Musk’s Starlink network suffers rare global outage
byline: SpaceX’s Starlink suffered one of its biggest international outages on Thursday when an internal software failure knocked tens of thousands of users offline, a rare disruption for Elon Musk‘s powerful satellite internet system.

title: Court orders FIB to record statements from Minister, Deputy Minister and Mayor
byline: The Mount Lavinia Magistrate has directed the Fraud Investigation Bureau (FIB) to record statements from Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe, Deputy Minister Mahinda Jayasinghe, and the Mayor of the Kaduwela Municipal Council, Ranjan Jayalal.

title: Sri Lanka to waive visa fees for 40 more countries – Foreign Minister
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka has decided to waive visa fees for 40 additional countries to boost tourism, stated Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath.

title: Sri Lankan migrant worker in viral video still traumatized after workplace humiliation in Korea
byline: A Sri Lankan migrant worker said he continues to suffer from trauma months after co-workers tied him to a forklift and mocked him at a brick factory in Naju, South Jeolla, in an incident that has fueled national outrage and triggered a government investigation into the abuse of foreign laborers.

title: Thailand declares martial law in eight districts bordering Cambodia
byline: Thailand declared martial law in eight of its districts bordering Cambodia on Friday, as the countries traded strikes in a second deadly day of clashes.

title: Over 300 kg of ganja seized in India; Sri Lankans among five arrested
byline: The Karaikal district police have seized over 300 kg of ganja and arrested five persons, including two Sri Lankan nationals, for their alleged involvement in an inter-state and cross-border smuggling network, Indian media reported today.

title: US rapper GloRilla complains after drugs arrest
byline: US rapper GloRilla has criticised police following her arrest on drug charges after officers said they found marijuana while investigating a burglary at her home.

title: Full list as Sri Lanka waives visa fees for 40 countries
byline: To boost their tourism, the Sri Lankan government has taken a major step by giving visa fee waivers to forty countries.

title: President AKD holds virtual tariff talks with US Trade Representative
byline: A virtual discussion was held this evening (25) between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and U.S. Trade Representative (USTR) Jamieson Greer regarding the further reduction of trade tariffs imposed by the United States on Sri Lankan exports.
